standard.head: Standard Property and Value
desc: You may use familiar utility classes for standard values that include any characters except for space or hyphen. Each class in the "know" attribute is separated by a space and analyzed by KnowCSS to determine your intention.
Note that KnowCSS will "mangle" these classes with color-000 become "a", font-size-18px becoming "b", light becoming "c", and so on...

complex.head: Complex Property and Value
desc: With the complex nature of CSS, the standard "property-value" above will work for most styles while others will require a slightly altered syntax.

Values with a space or hyphen should use an equal sign between the property and value to indicate which is which, with spaces converted to forward slash to keep the multi-value together in one property. This is to prevent any hyphen or space within the value from being misinterpreted by KnowCSS.
The equal sign will denote the property on the left and the value on the right while forward slash will denote that a value is a complex value with spaces present.
complex.more: Note: box-sizing-border-box would be interpeted as box-sizing-border: box; instead of the intended box-sizing: border-box;, so an = helps in this instance.
